newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian state notes issue reaches 5.612 bln Bfr.
newsitem.headline: Belgian state notes issue reaches 5.612 bln Bfr.

text.p: The Belgian Finance Ministry said in a statement on Monday that subscriptions to its latest issue of state notes had reached 5.612 billion francs at the end of the fifth day, Friday.

The finance ministry said it had sold 1.244 billion francs worth of its revisable coupon, 3/5/7-year notes and 4.368 billion francs of its five-year, fixed coupon note, which is extendable to seven years.
Belgium hopes to raise 54 billion francs from the four state note issues planned for 1997/1998. Last year it raised 53 billion francs when it had targeted 80 billion.
The state notes are aimed at retail investors in direct competition to commercial banks' savings, or "cash", bonds, traditionally Belgium's most popular investment vehicle.
The popularity of cash bonds has waned, however, against the background of falling European interest rates.
